description: Construction of 149 residential units (54 x 1 bed, 79 x 2 bed, 13 x 3 bed and 3 x 4 bed) ranging in height between one and four-storeys, with associated hardstanding, car parking, landscaping and boundary treatment works.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). |  The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved documents and plans:

Biodiversity Enhancement Scheme-Version-6, ref: 4132,EC/BIOENHANCE/RF,KL/27-02-20/V6, prepared by Geosphere Environmental, dated 27.02.2020; Badger Survey, prepared by David Archer Associates, dated June 2018; Precautionary Method of Working, prepared by David Archer Associates, dated July 2018; Preliminary Ecology Appraisal, prepared by David Archer Associates, dated September 2017; Reptile Mitigation Strategy, prepared by David Archer Associates, dated July 2018; Letter, RE Biodiversity, ref: 4757,EC-Ltr001-RF,KL-13.03.20-V1, prepared by GeoSphere Environmental to Mr. G Howarth, dated 13.03.2020; Affordable Housing Viability Statement, prepared by Adams Integra, dated March 2020; Affordable Housing and Affordability Statement, prepared by Progress Planning, dated 16.01.2020; Schedule of Accommodation, ref: PA-19-10-28_ScheduleOfAccommodation rev 1; Construction Strategy-Rev-1, prepared by Howarth Contractors Limited, dated 31.01.2020; Budget Cost Plan, prepared Johnson Associates Limited by dated 14.02.2020; Landscape Planting Palette, ref: 9996-DOC-01, prepared by Studio Loci, dated 20.09.2019; Planning Design and Access Statement-Version-3, prepared by Progress Planning, dated June 2020; Urban Green Factor Assessment-Rev-2, ref: UGF-23-Rev 2, prepared by Progress Planning, dated: 14.02.2020; Letter, RE Preliminary geo-environmental evaluation, prepared by T&P Regan to Mr. D Fisher, dated 21.06.2018; Transmittal Note, number T3486, prepared by South West Geotechnical Ltd, dated 28.06.2018; Transmittal Note, number T3486A, prepared by South West Geotechnical Ltd, dated 19.06.2018; Flood Risk Assessment-Rev-A, ref 170927-FRA-JR-RS-02, prepared by Lanmor Consulting, dated 22.11.2019; Drainage Strategy-Rev-A, ref , prepared by Lanmor Consulting, dated 22.11.2019; Transport Statement-Rev-A, ref 170927/TS/MK/KL/02, prepared by Lanmor Consulting, dated 22.11.2019; Travel Plan-Rev-A, ref 170927/TP/JR/KL/02, prepared by Lanmor Consulting, dated 22.11.2019; Arboricultural and Planning Integration Report, ref: GHA/DS/13860:19, prepared by GHA Trees, dated 12.11.2019; Tree Protection Plan-Rev-B, prepared by GHA Trees, dated November 2019; Energy Strategy-Rev-E, prepared by Energist , dated 14.11.2019; Letter, RE extended disuse of land, prepared by Ms Marion Budd (Northolt High School), dated 26.04.2017; Letter, RE disposal of school land, prepared by Ms L Whitesman (Education and Skills Funding Agency), dated 02.06.2017; L1020-Rev-P1; 9996-GA-01A; 170927-PL-01; L1340-Rev-P3; L1300-Rev-P3; L1301-Rev-P3; L1100-Rev-P3; L1302-Rev-P3; L1303-Rev-P3; L1201-Rev-P3; L1304-Rev-P4; L1305-Rev-P4; L1202-Rev-P4; L1306-Rev-P4; L1307-Rev-P4; L1203-Rev-P4; L1308-Rev-P4; L1309-Rev-P4; L1204-Rev-P4; L1327-Rev-P4; L1328-Rev-P4; L1207-Rev-P4; L1312-Rev-P3; L1313-Rev-P3; L1101-Rev-P3; L1314-Rev-P3; L1315-Rev-P3; L1102-Rev-P3; L1316-Rev-P3; L1317-Rev-P3; L1103-Rev-P3; L1318-Rev-P3; L1319-Rev-P3; L1104-Rev-P3; L1322-Rev-P3; L1323-Rev-P3; L1324-Rev-P3; L1106-Rev-P3; L1105-Rev-P3; L1310-Rev-P4; L1311-Rev-P4; L1205-Rev-P4; L1325-Rev-P3; L1326-Rev-P3; L1206-Rev-P3; L1000-Rev-P4; L1001-Rev-P4; L1410-Rev-P3; L1401-Rev-P3; L1402-Rev-P3; L1403-Rev-P3; L1404-Rev-P3; L1405-Rev-P3; L1406-Rev-P3; L0002-Rev-P2; L0010-Rev-P2; L0011-Rev-P2; L0012-Rev-P2; L0013-Rev-P2; L0014-Rev-P2; Statement of Community Involvement, prepared by Polity, dated November 2019; L0001-Rev-P2; L1320 Rev P3; L1321 Rev P3; Daylight Report, prepared by Lumina, dated 15.06.2020.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, samples of materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces/proposed facing materials shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development (excluding ground works and site clearance). The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan and Policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved (including site clearance and ground works), a Construction and Environmental Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following details:
1) on-site construction worker parking;
2) routes the traffic will use and the number, frequency and size of construction vehicles;
3) delivery times and locations;

4) vehicle manoeuvring including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how construction vehicles will access the site, turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear, including details of any temporary vehicle access points;
5) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from residents;

6) measures noise and vibration in accordance with BS5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014, for dust in accordance with the GLA's SPG for 'The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' and lighting in accordance with the ILP's 'Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution (2011)'.

7) undertaking for all 'Non-Road Mobile Machinery' (NRMM) to be used during the construction of the development to be registered on the NRMM register and meet the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC.

8) measures to protect existing habitats and priority species (slow worms) on the development site including but not limited to details of an ecological clerk of works; seasonal timing of works; measures to prevent entrapment of slow worms and other wildlife. The CEMP should also set out clearly how the following will be protected from works:
- protection of the habitat corridor along the northern boundary (trees and scrub vegetation)
- any temporary lighting (see lighting strategy)
The approved details shall be implemented throughout the construction period.

Reason: In the interest of safety and to protect residential amenity and to ensure that protection of ecological features and protected/notable species in accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.10, 6.14, 7.14, 7.15 and 7.19 of The London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | A minimum of 4 publicly accessible short stay visitor cycle parking spaces and 267 covered/sheltered and secure cycle parking spaces shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport in accordance with Policy 6.9 of The London Plan, Policy T5 of the Draft London Plan and Ealing's Supplementary Planning Document 'Sustainable Transport for New Development'. | A minimum of four disabled person car parking spaces designed in accordance with BS8300vol.1 and an additional seven enlarged car parking spaces (suitable to be allocated as disabled person parking) shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved. This minimum provision shall be maintained in perpetuity, unless enlarged car parking spaces are reallocated for disabled person parking.

Reason: To ensure appropriate disabled person car parking is provided in accordance with Policy 6.13 of The London Plan and Policy T6.1 in the Draft London Plan. | Prior to the first occupation of the residential development hereby permitted, at least 20% of car parking spaces (minimum of 22 spaces) shall be fitted and with operational active vehicle charging facilities, while passive electric vehicle charging facilities shall be provided on all remaining car parking spaces. The electric or Ultra-Low Emission car charging facilities shall permanently be retained as such thereafter, unless passive electric vehicle charging points are being upgraded to active charging points.

Reason: To ensure appropriate provision of suitable infrastructure for electric or Ultra-Low Emission vehicles in accordance with Draft London Plan Policy T6.1. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted, a Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include hours of use, times and frequency of activities, deliveries and collections, vehicle movements, location of loading bays and quiet loading/unloading measures. The document shall also include measures to encourage cycling freight trips. The approved plan shall be adhered to permanently thereafter.

Reason: To minimise the impact on residential amenity and ensure safety in accordance with Policies 6.14 and 7.15 of The London Plan, Policy T7 of the Draft London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a Car Park Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Detail shall include how the electric vehicle charging points, disabled person parking spaces and enlarged spaces will be provided and managed and how remaining space would be allocated. The approved Plan shall be adhered to in perpetuity and reviewed at least every three years.

Reason: To ensure car parking is appropriately managed in accordance with Policy T6 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of onsite raised tables shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Approved speed reduction measures shall be installed prior to first occupation and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To reduce vehicle speed and ensure safety in accordance with Policies 6.9, 6.10 and 6.12 of The London Plan. | Prior to commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance) an Arboricultural Method Statement shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process, considering site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:

- Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads;
- A plan** detailing all trees and hedgerows planned for retention and removal;

- A schedule of tree works for all the retained trees specifying pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological, hazard abatement, aesthetic or operational reasons.  All tree works shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998;
- Soil assessments/survey;
- Timing and phasing of works;
- Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications;
- Site specific construction specifications (e.g. in connection with foundations, bridging, water features, surfacing);
- Access arrangements and car parking;
- Level changes;
- Landscaping proposals;

- A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces;
- Soil remediation plans, where unauthorised access has damaged root protection areas in the construction exclusion zones;
- Details of the arboricultural supervision schedule.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall be installed prior to commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance) and not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site.

Any trees, shrubs or hedges removed without consent, die, are severely damaged or become seriously diseased within five years from the completion of the approved development, shall be replaced with trees, shrubs or hedges capable of achieving comparable quantity and quality.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | (a) Prior to the commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance), the following shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
A Tree Monitoring Plan to include:
- Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development;
- Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key responsibilities and contact  details;
- Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to arboricultural matters;
- A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all tree protection measures within the approved Tree Protection Plan, including:
- Prestart meeting with an Ealing Council Tree Officer;
- Initial implementation/installation of the tree protection measures;
- Approved incursions into construction exclusion zones;
- Final removal of the tree protection measures;
- Procedures for dealing with non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved arboricultural plans and reports.
(b) Within three months of first occupation of the development hereby approved, a report containing the following details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
- Results of each site visit by the lead arboriculturist with photos attached.
- Assessment of the retained and planted trees, including any necessary remedial action because of damage incurred during construction.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection and to contribute to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | A suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and pits shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved.  The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details:
- Full planting specification - tree size, species, the numbers of trees and any changes from the original application proposals.
- Locations of all proposed species.
- Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation to include:
- Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity
- Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root barriers/deflectors) in the future
- Staking/tying method(s).
- Five-year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule.

All tree planting must be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following first use of the approved development. The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Any trees which die, are removed, uprooted, significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed within five years from the completion of planting, must be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive), with a tree/s of the same size, species and quality as previously approved.

Reason: To contribute to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of The London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | (a) Urban Greening Factor measures to achieve a minimum score of 0.46 shall be implemented in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following first occupation of the approved development.

(b) Within six months of implementation of Urban Greening Factor measures, details of onsite green infrastructure shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to verify the UGF score of 0.46 has been attained.
The approved UGF measure to achieve a score of 0.46 shall permanently be maintained in accordance with the Landscape Management Plan (condition 18).

Reason: To ensure appropriate levels of high-quality landscaping and urban greening measures are provided in accordance with Policy G5 in the Draft London Plan and Policy 5.10 in the Development Management DPD. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of the 2,470 sq. m. of extensive green roof shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include:
- Construction drawings to include a plan and a cross-section;
- Native wildflower seed mix (turf or sedum blanket will not be accepted);
- Substrate depth between 80mm-150mm;
- Small piles of untreated logs;
- No irrigation;
- Green roof construction to be supervised by a suitable qualified landscape/ecology contractor.
(b) Prior to the first occupation, a five-year post planting green roof maintenance and inspection schedule shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

The approved green roofs shall be installed within the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following first occupation at the latest and shall be retained as such thereafter, with the approved maintenance plan adhered to in perpetuity.

Reason:  To ensure the development contributes towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan, Plan Policy G5 of the Draft London Plan, the Greater London Authority, Living Roofs and Walls, Technical Report: Supporting London Plan Policy and Policies 5.10 and 5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to first occupation of the residential units, revised landscape planting details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include:
- Full details of species, numbers, size and location;
- Planting on site should compromise a large majority of native species or those of known value to wildlife.
- Species that provide edible fruit, berries, seeds and/or nectar should be prioritized
- Details of rain gardens and green roofs
- Habitat and connectivity for slow worms (e.g. rain gardens, meadow areas, hedges) Landscape planting scheme offsite (in Northolt Park):
- How neutral grassland will be created
- Full details of species, numbers, size and location,
- Refugia for reptiles
Approved details shall be installed within the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following first occupation and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that appropriate biodiversity mitigation is implemented to achieve a net gain for local wildlife in accordance with Paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework, Policy G5 and G6 of the Draft London Plan and Policy 5.10 of the Development Management DPD. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a Landscape Management Plan in accordance with BS42020 Code of Practice for planning and development, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall include:
- Management details for ten years post development completion;
- Use adaptive management techniques enhance biodiversity;
- Include details of reptile mitigation and long-term maintenance of features;
- Include Ecological surveys to monitor slow-worm population and assess habitat quality/condition-by a suitable qualified ecologist in second, fifth and tenth year, post development completion.
The approved Plan shall be adhered to for the ten-year plan period.

Reason: To ensure landscaping, urban greening and biodiversity measures are established and appropriately maintained in accordance with Paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework, Policies G5 and G6 of the Draft London Plan and Policy 5.10 of the Development Management DPD. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and prior to the use of outdoor lighting, details of external lighting shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include geo-referenced lux contour plans and details of measures to prevent light spill onto retained ecological features and new habitat within and immediately adjacent to the development site.

Reason: To avoid potential impact to roosting or foraging bats on or adjacent to the site in accordance with Principle 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policy G6 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to any vegetation removal, ecological features shall be assessed by a Suitably Qualified Bat Ecologist for the potential to support roosting bats. The survey shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to any vegetation removal. If evidence of roosting bats is found, protection and mitigation details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to any vegetation removal.

Reason: To avoid potential impact to roosting or foraging bats on or adjacent to the site in accordance with Principle 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policy G6 of the Draft London Plan. | (a) Biodiversity enhancement measures shall be provided in accordance with the Biodiversity Enhancement Scheme, prepared by GeoSphere Environmental, dated 27.02.2020 (ref: 4132,EC/BIOENHANCE/RF,KL/27-02-20/V6) in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following first occupation and shall permanently be maintained in accordance with the Landscape Management Plan (condition 17). Measures include:
- at least four bat boxes;
- native planting and night scented plants;
- meadow and wildflower planting;
- creation of species-rich hedgerows;
- creation of hibernacula, including artificial refugia and rock/deadwood piles within soft-landscaping;
- at least four bird boxes;
- at least three log piles.

(b) Within six months of implementation of biodiversity enhancement measures, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to verify compliance with the submitted 'Biodiversity Metric Calculations' (appendix 8 of Biodiversity Enhancement Scheme, prepared by GeoSphere Environmental, dated 27.02.2020).

Reason: To ensure that appropriate biodiversity mitigation is implemented to achieve a net gain for local wildlife in accordance with Paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework, Policy G5 and G6 of the Draft London Plan and Policy 5.10 of the Development Management DPD. | (a) Prior to the commencement of development (excluding site clearance) and remediation works, an intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance, a revised conceptual site model and remediation scheme shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990. Approved measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of development (excluding site clearance).

(b) Following implementation of the approved remediation measures and prior to first occupation, a verification report in accordance with the latest Environment Agency guidance and industry best practice shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance Policy 5.21 of The London Plan and Policy 5.21 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Noise sensitive rooms in neighbouring residential flats shall be constructed to achieve an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, communal stairs and bin stores, and halls, bathrooms and kitchens above/below bedrooms of adjoining dwellings. This standard shall be achieved prior to first occupation of residential units and shall permanently be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard residential amenity in accordance with Policy 7.15 of The London Plan, Policy 1.1 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration' and the criteria of BS8233:2014. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, at least 10% of the residential units shall meet Building Regulation requirement M4(3) 'wheelchair user dwellings', with all remaining units required to meet Building Regulation requirement M4(2) 'accessible and adoptable dwellings'. These access standards shall be retained in perpetuity, unless 'accessible and adoptable dwellings' are altered to 'wheelchair user dwellings'.

Reason: To ensure the appropriate provision of accessible dwellings in accordance with Policy 3.8 of The London Plan and Policy D5 of the Draft London Plan. | a) Prior to commencement of development (excluding site clearance and ground works), details of the specifications, design and layout of the proposed PV panels shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Equipment details shall include the kWp capacity, orientation, pitch and mounting of photovoltaic panels. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and retained as such thereafter.

b) Prior to first occupation, the development shall incorporate, maintain in perpetuity, and in the case of energy generation equipment, confirm as operational, the approved measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated carbon dioxide emissions of at least 35.66% (equal to 69.87 tonnes of carbon dioxide per year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. These carbon dioxide savings shall be achieved through the Lean, Clean, Green Energy Hierarchy as detailed in the approved Energy Statement prepared by Energist, dated November 2019, including:
i) Lean passive design measures to achieve an annual reduction of at least 8.46% equating to at least 16.57 tonnes in regulated carbon dioxide emissions over BR Part L 2013;

ii) Green renewable energy equipment including the incorporation of seven photovoltaic arrays with a combined total capacity of at least 110 kWp to achieve an annual reduction of at least 29.71%, equating to 53 tonnes in regulated carbon dioxide emissions over the Be Lean/Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

c) The relevant Energy Performance Certificates and/or Display Energy Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and detailed BRUKL modelling output reports showing clearly the BER and TER from the 'as built stage' to confirm energy efficiency compliance, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Authority within three months of first occupation. The approved measures shall be maintained in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmental sustainable development in accordance with Policies, 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of The London Plan, guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance, Policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to commencement of the approved development (excluding ground works and site clearance), the details of the dynamic thermal modelling for each unit (or an agreed percentage of the apartments) shall be undertaken using the guidance provided in CIBSE TM49 and TM52, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. The approved development shall not be occupied until the relevant approved measures have been installed and are operational. The approved measures shall permanently be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the risk of overheating has been sufficiently addressed in accordance with policy 5.9 of the London Plan and Policies D6 and SI4 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, buildings shall incorporate and maintain ultra-low NOx gas boilers for the provision of energy requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh (ultra-low NOx).

Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in accordance with Policies 3.2 and 7.14 of The London Plan, the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | (a) Prior to commencement of development (excluding ground works and site clearance), the developer shall contact the Council's chosen AEMP supplier (Energence Ltd) to facilitate the energy monitoring process.

(b) Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, suitable energy monitoring devices shall be installed. The monitored data shall be automatically submitted to the Council at daily intervals in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy Monitoring Platform information document. The developer shall submit to the Council proof of a contractual arrangement with a certified contractor that provides for the ongoing commissioning, maintenance, and repair of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment for a period of at least three years from the date of first occupation.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness and continued operation of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment and to confirm compliance with Policy 5.2 of The London Plan, the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG and Policy 5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of the development (excluding ground works and site clearance), Sustainable Design and Construction strategies, including full details of the measures that are to be incorporated into the development, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved measures.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan, the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG and Policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a detailed drainage design shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drainage design prior to first occupation and maintained in perpetuity.

Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Principle 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of The London Plan. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, a maintenance plan for the proposed drainage system for the lifetime of the development shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved plan shall be adhered to in perpetuity.

Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Principle 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of The London Plan. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of Secure by Design accreditation shall be submitted to and approved by t
